column1: Health in Humanitarian Crises by Distance Learning (MSc)
column2: London School of Hygiene & Tropical Medicine
column3: Faculty of Public Health and Policy
column5: Humanitarian emergencies due to armed conflict, natural disasters, disease outbreaks and other causes are major contributors to ill health and vulnerability worldwide. The persisting effects of crises on health and health systems can undermine decades of social development.This new programme provides you with the knowledge and skills to improve the health of populations, communities and particular groups within them when these populations are affected by humanitarian crises. You are encouraged to develop transferable and subject-specific skills to address multi-faceted and current health problems in their local setting, as well as internationally.
